intro: Simocheilus globifer, commonly known as the globeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spherical flower heads, which consist of numerous small, tubular flowers clustered together. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The globeflower is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
